Police across Canada warn parents after morphine, staples, needles found in candy
items.description: Police in Ontario and Saskatchewan are warning parents to check Halloween candy after reports of tampered treats, including a suspected opioid in Mattawa and metal in Regina.

items.title: Pierre Poilievre won’t say if his Conservatives will strike down upcoming federal budget
items.description: With just days to go until the Liberal government introduces its much-anticipated federal budget, Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre won’t say whether his party will strike down the legislation — instead insisting he needs to read the document before deciding.

items.description: The Richmond restaurant took home the honours once again.

items.title: Q&A: Director Alireza Khatami on making Canada’s Oscar submission, The Things You Kill
items.description: “I showed the depth of my darkness, hoping people would look at their own.”

items.title: Chris Tanev hospitalized after collision in Maple Leafs' win
items.description: Maple Leafs defenceman Chris Tanev was taken to hospital after a collision in Toronto’s 5-2 win over Philadelphia but had movement in all extremities, coach Craig Berube said.

The municipal election is on across Quebec on Sunday. Here are a few things to know
items.description: Quebecers head to the polls Sunday to elect municipal leaders as key issues like housing, homelessness and affordability shape races across the province.

items.title: You Nearly Missed: Ada Lea promises to inspire at LanaLou's in Vancouver

items.title: ABBA tribute ABRA Cadabra brings high-energy holiday love to the Lower Mainland this December!
items.description: "We're there to bring joy, connect people, and engage with our audience."

items.title: What’s going to be in Carney’s first budget?
items.description: After weeks of federal government spending announcements leading up to budget day, the biggest unknown remains how large the deficit will be and where and how deep the expected cuts will land.

items.title: Blue Jays infielder Ernie Clement sets MLB record with 30 hits in postseason
items.description: Ernie Clement set an MLB record with 30 postseason hits, breaking Randy Arozarena’s mark. He hit .417, extended his streak to 13 games, and nearly won Game 7 for Toronto.

items.title: Dodgers players and manager appreciate Blue Jays' tribute to L.A. reliever Alex Vesia
items.description: Blue Jays relievers honored Dodgers pitcher Alex Vesia in Game 6 by writing his number “51” on their caps, a gesture that moved L.A. players amid his family’s personal hardship.

items.title: Canadian Red Cross sending hurricane relief to Jamaica after Melissa devastation
items.description: The Canadian Red Cross has sent more than 18,000 relief items to Jamaica after Hurricane Melissa struck as a Category 5 storm, leaving at least 19 dead and widespread devastation.

items.title: Here's why sleep experts think we should abolish daylight saving time
items.description: While it usually only takes most Canadians a few days to adjust to the shift between daylight saving time and standard time, sleep experts say the constant time travel back and forth harms our sleep and has a negative affect on our body's internal clocks.

items.title: With Día de Muertos, Mexican Quebecers keep traditions — and the dead — alive
items.description: During this multi-day commemoration, Mexicans and the diaspora reflect on life, death, and memories they shared with their late loved ones. Some Mexican Quebecers have channeled that grief to share their culture with wider audiences.
